401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

get.description: Retrieve a stream of logs generated by a workload instance's containers. Logs are generated by the containers and are not modified by StackPath. Log contents vary by the application running in the container, though many containerized applications are configured to log to STDOUT and STDERR.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: container_name
parameters.description: The name of the container to obtain logs for. This defaults to first container in the instance.

parameters.name: follow
parameters.description: Whether or not to follow the instance's log stream. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: previous
parameters.description: Whether or not to return log entries made by previously terminated containers. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: since_seconds
parameters.description:
A relative time in seconds before the current time from which to show logs. If this value precedes the time an instance was started, only logs since the instance's start time will be returned. If this value is in the future, no logs will be returned.

Only one of since_seconds or since_time may be specified

parameters.name: since_time
parameters.description:
An RFC3339 timestamp from which to show logs. If this value precedes the time an instance was started, only logs since the instance's start time will be returned. If this value is in the future, no logs will be returned.

Only one of since_seconds or since_time may be specified

parameters.name: timestamps
parameters.description: Whether or not to add an RFC3339 or RFC3339Nano timestamp at the beginning of every line of log output. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: tail_lines
parameters.description: The number of lines from the end of the logs to show. If not specified, logs are shown from the creation of the container or since_seconds or since_time.

parameters.name: limit_bytes
parameters.description: The number of bytes to read from the server before terminating log output. This may not display a complete final line of logging, and may return slightly more or slightly less than the specified limit.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

post.description: The action is performed asynchronously and a successful response does not mean the instance has restarted yet.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

exitCode.description: The exit code of the command that started the container

message.description: A more detailed explanation of a container's termination

reason.description: The reason that a container is waiting to start

message.description: A more detailed explanation of a container's waiting state

ContainerStatusWaiting.description: Properties related to containers that are starting up

DataMatrix.description: A set of time series containing a range of data points over time for each time series

DataMatrixResult.description: Time series containing a range of data points over time for each time series

unixTime.description: The time that a data point was recorded

DataVector.description: A set of time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

DataVectorResult.description: Time series containing a single sample for each time series, all sharing the same timestamp

MetricsData.description: The data points in a metrics collection

VolumeClaimVolumeClaimPhase.description:
Which phase a volume claim is currently in

- VOLUME_CLAIM_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: StackPath is unable to determine the volume claim's state
 - PENDING: The volume claim is pending
 - UNBOUND: The volume claim is unbound
 - BOUND: The volume claim is bound to an instance

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.

errorType.description: The type of error encountered when querying for metrics

error.description: The error encountered when querying for metrics

warnings.description: Warnings encountered when querying for metrics

add.description: List of supported capabilities to add in container

drop.description: List of supported capabilities to drop from container

v1ContainerCapabilities.description: The specification for capabilities to add/drop when running containersSupported capabilities are [cap_chown, cap_dac_override, cap_dac_read_search, cap_fowner, cap_fsetid, cap_kill, cap_setgid, cap_setuid, cap_setpcap, cap_linux_immutable,cap_net_bind_service, cap_net_broadcast, cap_net_admin, cap_net_raw, cap_ipc_lock, cap_ipc_owner,cap_sys_chroot, cap_sys_ptrace, cap_sys_pacct, cap_sys_nice, cap_mknod, cap_lease, cap_setfcap]

v1ContainerImagePullPolicy.description: The image pull policy for the container image. The value should be one of ALWAYS or IF_NOT_PRESENT

v1ContainerLifecycle.description: Defines actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events

v1ContainerLifecycleHandler.description: Defines a specific lifecycle management action that should be taken

runAsUser.description: The user UID to run the entry point of the container process

runAsGroup.description: The user GID to run the entry point of the container process

runAsNonRoot.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user

readOnlyRootFilesystem.description: Indicates whether this container has a read-only root filesystem

allowPrivilegeEscalation.description: Controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process

v1ContainerSecurityContext.description: Security configuration that will be applied to a container

image.description: The location of a Docker image to run as a container

command.description: The commands that start a container

args.description: Arguments to the container entry point

volumeMounts.description: Volumes to mount in the container

terminationMessagePath.description: Mounted file path at which the container's termination message will be written

v1ContainerSpec.description: The specification for the desired state of a container in a workload

v1ContainerSpecMapEntry.description: A string to container configuration key/value pair

ready.description: Whether or not a container is running and ready for service

restartCount.description: How many times a container has restarted since it was first started

containerId.description: A unique value that identifies a container

v1ContainerStatus.description: The status of a container in a workload

v1ContainerStatusContainerPhase.description:
Which phase of runtime a container is currently in

- CONTAINER_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: The container has not reported a state back or StackPath is unable to determine the container's state
 - STARTING: The container is starting up
 - RUNNING: The container is running
 - FAILED: The container has terminated due to a failure
 - STOPPED: The container was terminated by the user

v1ContainerTerminationMessagePolicy.description: The policy indicating how the termination message should be populated

v1CreateImageResponse.description: A response from a request to create an image

v1CreateWorkloadResponse.description: A response from a request to add a workload to a stack

nameservers.description: A list of DNS name server IP addresses

searches.description: A list of DNS search domains for hostname lookup

options.description: A list of DNS resolver options

v1DNSConfig.description: Specification to control DNS settings for workload instanceIt is used to control resolver config such as DNS nameservers, search domains and resolver options for workload instance

v1DNSConfigOption.description: Specification for DNS resolver options, More information about DNS resolveroptions are available here - https://www.man7.org/linux/man-pages/man5/resolv.conf.5.html

minReplicas.description: The minimum number of instances in a deployment

maxReplicas.description: The maximum number of instances in a deployment

selectors.description: A collection of filters that match the deployment's scope

server.description:
The server that the credentials should be used with

The server that the credentials should be used with. This value will default to the docker hub registry when not set.

username.description: The username that should be used for authenticate the image pull

password.description: The password that should be used to authenticate the image pull

email.description: The email address to use for the docker registry account

v1DockerRegistryCredentials.description: The authentication configuration that should be used to pull images from a docker registry

secretValue.description: A sensitive environment variable that should not be exposed

v1EnvironmentVariable.description: The location to obtain a value for an environment variable

v1EnvironmentVariableMapEntry.description: A string to environment variable key/value pair

v1EnvironmentVariableSource.description: An environment variable derived from an external source

command.description: Command to run in container through container exec

v1ExecAction.description: Execute an command inside container through container exec for probes/lifecycle actions

v1GetImageResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve an individual image

v1GetImagesForFamilyResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve images by a family

v1GetImagesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve images for a stack

v1GetLocationsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve the locations a workload may be created at

v1GetWorkloadInstanceInitialPasswordResp.description: A response from a request to retrieve a workload's instance's initial password

v1GetWorkloadInstanceResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a workload's instances

v1GetWorkloadInstancesResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a workload's instances

v1GetWorkloadResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve an individual workload

v1GetWorkloadsResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a stack's workloads

path.description: The path portion of the URL to request

port.description: The TCP port to query in the HTTP request

scheme.description: HTTP scheme to use in the HTTP request

v1HTTPGetAction.description: Execute an HTTP GET request against an endpoint running on an instance

ip.description: An IP address to be injected in container workload instance's host file

hostnames.description: A list of hostnames to be injected in container workload instance's host file

v1HostAlias.description: The hosts and IPs that will be injected into the container workload instance's hosts file

v1IPFamily.description:
supported IP families

- IP_FAMILY_UNSPECIFIED: Unknown IP family
 - IPv4: IPv4 IP family.
 - IPv6: IPv6 IP family. Currently, IPv6 IP family must be used with IPv4.

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that an image belongs to

family.description:
An image's family

Families are logical groupings of images

tag.description:
The image's tag

Image tags are akin to versions

description.description:
An image's description

This is optional and may not be more than 1,000 characters

imageSize.description:
An image's archive size in bytes

This is only available on ready images

volumeSize.description:
An image's volume size in bytes

This is only available on ready images

checkedAt.description: The last time the condition was checked

transitionedAt.description: The last time the condition transitioned status

reason.description: A stable identifier for the reason the condition is in its current state

message.description: A human readable message with details regarding the condition

v1ImageCondition.description: Further information about an image's status

v1ImageConditionStatus.description:
Which status an image is currently in

- IMAGE_CONDITION_STATUS_UNKNOWN: The condition status is unknown
 - TRUE: The condition is true
 - FALSE: The condition is false

deprecationDate.description:
The date when an image is considered deprecated

Deprecated images may be used in new virtual machine based workloads, but are no longer considered for the "default" tag, nor are they returned in image lists by default.

obsoletionDate.description:
The date when an image is considered obsolete

Obsolete images may not be used in new virtual machine based workloads. If an obsoletion date is present then the deprecation date must also be present with a same or earlier date.

deletionDate.description:
The date when an image is deleted

Deletion dates cannot be before an image's deprecation or obsoletion dates.

createdAt.description:
The date that a workload image was created

The date an image was created

updatedAt.description:
The date that a workload image was last updated

The date an image was last updated

v1ImagePullCredential.description: The credentials that should be used to pull the container image

workloadId.description: The ID or slug of the workload containing the instance to reference

instanceName.description: An instance's name to reference a volume on

volumeClaimSlug.description: A reference to the volume to create an image from or unset for the root volume

v1ImageSourceInstanceVolume.description: A reference to the volume of an instance to capture an image from

v1ImageStatus.description:
Which capture status an image is currently in

- IMAGE_STATUS_UNKNOWN: The image status is unknown
 - PENDING: The image is pending creation
 - PROCESSING: The image is processing
 - READY: The image is ready
 - FAILED: The image failed to be created

fieldPath.description:
An instance field's path

A [JSON path expression](https://jsonpath.com/) to an instance field. For example:

 * `.name`
 * `.location.cityCode`
 * `.ipAddress`
 * `.containers[0].image`
 * `.networkInterfaces[?(@.network==\"default\")].gateway`

Dots inside of map keys need to be escaped: `.metadata.labels['workload\\.platform\\.stackpath\\.net/workload-slug']`. Recursive descent, union operators, and range/end operators are not allowed.

optional.description:
Whether the field value is not required to start an instance

If a field is optional then there is no guarantee it will be provided to the environment before the container starts.

v1InstanceFieldRef.description: A reference to a workload instance field

protocol.description:
The network protocol for the port

Values are either "TCP" or "UDP". Defaults to "TCP".

enableImplicitNetworkPolicy.description:
Allow the internet to connect to the port

When true, this port will be given an implicit network policy of priority 65534 permitting 0.0.0.0/0 access to the port. This can be overridden by creating network policies of a higher priority to block the port.

v1InstancePort.description: A named port for an instance of a workload

v1InstancePortMapEntry.description: A string to network port key/value pair

slug.description: The slug of the volume claim to mount

mountPath.description: The path in an instance to mount a volume

v1InstanceVolumeMount.description: Describes mounting a volume on containers or vms in an instance

v1LogChunk.description: A chunk of raw log data

key.description: The name of the selector to perform a match against

operator.description:
The operation to perform to match a selector

Valid values are "In", "NotIn", "Exists", and "DoesNotExist".

values.description: The values to match in the selector

v1MatchExpression.description: An expression to match selectors against a set of values

createdAt.description: The date that a metadata entry was created

updatedAt.description: The date that a metadata entry was last updated

deleteRequestedAt.description: The date an entity was requested to be deleted

version.description:
A metadata entry's version number

Metadata versions start at 1 when they are created and increment by 1 every time they are updated.

averageValue.description: The target average value for the metric measured across all instances within a deployment, expressed as a quantity.

averageUtilization.description: The target average value for the metric measured across all instances within a deployment, expressed as a percentage of requested resources.

ipFamilies.description:
A list of IP families to use for interface ip assignments

This is an optional property and supports ['IPv4'] or ['IPv4', 'IPv6'] list

subnet.description: An IPv4 subnet interface's slug. This is an optional property used to attach a specific network interface to a IPv4 subnet.

ipv6Subnet.description: An IPv6 subnet interface's slug. This is an optional property used to attach a specific network interface to a ipv6 subnet.

enableOneToOneNat.description:
Whether to provide [one-to-one NAT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_address_translation#Basic_NAT) for this network interface

This is an optional property used to enable or disable the NAT'ing the network interface. NAT is enabled by default on the first/primary interface and disabled on secondary/multi interfaces.

Mark this property `false` to disable NAT on the first interface. Mark this property `true` to enable NAT on secondary interfaces.

The `ExcludeNAT` workload annotation supercedes this property.

v1NetworkInterface.description: Network interfaces that will be created on instances in the workload

initialDelaySeconds.description: The number of seconds after a workload instance has started before liveness probes are initiated

timeoutSeconds.description:
The number of seconds after which a probe times out

Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1.

periodSeconds.description:
How often, in seconds, to perform a probe

Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.

successThreshold.description:
The minimum consecutive successes for a probe to be considered successful after having failed

Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness. Minimum value is 1.

failureThreshold.description:
The minimum consecutive failures for a probe to be considered failed after having succeeded

Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.

v1Probe.description: A health check probe against a workload instance to determine if it is alive or ready to receive traffic

v1PutWorkloadResponse.description: A response from a request to replace an existing workload

v1ResourceRequirements.description:
Resource requirements are key/value pairs.

Resource requirements for an object. The values supported by workloads are:
- cpu
- memory
- nvidia-a2: limited to specific markets
- ephemeral-storage: deprecated and has no effect

metrics.description: Metrics to observe for invoking scaling events.

v1StringMapEntry.description: A string to string key/value pair

v1Sysctl.description: Kernel sysctl parameter to optimize the performance of a container

v1TCPSocketAction.description: Connect to an instance's TCP port

v1Target.description: How instances in a workload should be deployed

v1TargetMapEntry.description: A string to deployment target key/value pair

deploymentScope.description: The scope at which a deployment should be created. Valid values are: "cityCode"

v1UpdateImageDeprecationResponse.description: A response from a request to update image deprecation settings

v1UpdateImageResponse.description: A response from a request to update an image

v1UpdateWorkloadResponse.description: A response from a request to update a workload

image.description:
The image to use for the virtual machine

This is in the format of <stack-slug>/<image-family>[:<image-tag>]. If the image tag portion is omitted, 'default' is assumed which is the most recently created, ready, and non-deprecated image of that slug. A set of common images is present on the 'stackpath-edge' stack.

volumeMounts.description: Volumes to mount in the virtual machine

v1VirtualMachineSpec.description: The specification for the desired state of a virtual machine in a workload

v1VirtualMachineSpecMapEntry.description: A string to virtual machine configuration key/value pair

name.description: The name of the virtual machine the status applies to

reason.description: A short reason why the virtual machine is in its current phase

message.description: A longer message with details about why the virtual machine is in its current phase

v1VirtualMachineStatus.description: The status of a Virtual Machine

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that a volume claim belongs to

name.description: A volume claim's name as it appears in the StackPath portal

slug.description:
A volume claim's programmatic name

Volume claim slugs are used to programatically label a claim

v1VolumeClaim.description:
A claim for a volume

Volumes may be attached to workload instance containers or virtual machines

storageClass.description:
Storage class for a volume claim

This defaults to the 'stackpath-edge/san' value if none is provided.

v1VolumeClaimSpec.description: The specification for a volume claim

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that a workload belongs to

name.description: A workload's name as it appears in the StackPath portal

slug.description:
A workload's programmatic name

Workload slugs are used to build its instances names

v1Workload.description:
A computing workload

Workloads define a computing application to deploy to StackPath's edge network.

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: The duration in seconds the workload instance needs to terminate gracefully. The value should belong to [0-300] seconds range

shareProcessNamespace.description: Whether to run all containers of workload instance in a single process namespace

hostAliases.description: The list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the workload instance's hosts file

v1WorkloadInstanceContainerRuntimeSettin.description: The specification for container settings which are applicable to all workload instance containers

v1WorkloadInstanceRuntimeSettings.description: The specification for workload instance level settings

runAsUser.description: The user UID to run the entry point of the container process

runAsGroup.description: The user GID to run the entry point of the container process

runAsNonRoot.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user

supplementalGroups.description: The additional list of user groups applied to the first process run in each container running in the workload instance

sysctls.description: The list of kernel sysctl parameters to optimize the performance of a containersupported sysctls are [kernel.msgmax, kernel.msgmnb, kernel.pid_max, kernel.shmall, kernel.shmmax, kernel.shm_rmid_forced, net.core.netdev_budget, net.core.netdev_budget_usecs, net.core.netdev_max_backlog, net.core.optmem_max, net.core.rmem_default, net.core.rmem_max, net.core.somaxconn, net.core.wmem_default, net.core.wmem_max, net.ipv4.conf.$interface.accept_local, net.ipv4.conf.$interface.arp_announce, net.ipv4.conf.$interface.arp_ignore, net.ipv4.conf.$interface.rp_filter, net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_local, net.ipv4.conf.all.arp_announce, net.ipv4.conf.all.arp_ignore, net.ipv4.conf.all.force_igmp_version, net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter, net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_local, net.ipv4.conf.default.accept_source_route, net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter, net.ipv4.conf.lo.accept_local, net.ipv4.conf.lo.arp_announce, net.ipv4.conf.lo.arp_filter, net.ipv4.conf.lo.arp_ignore, net.ipv4.conf.lo.rp_filter, net.ipv4.ip_forward, net.ipv4.ip_local_port_range, net.ipv4.ip_local_reserved_ports, net.ipv4.ip_unprivileged_port_start, net.ipv4.ping_group_range, net.ipv4.tcp_base_mss, net.ipv4.tcp_congestion_control, net.ipv4.tcp_early_retrans, net.ipv4.tcp_ecn, net.ipv4.tcp_enable_last_ack_timer, net.ipv4.tcp_fin_timeout, net.ipv4.tcp_frto_response, net.ipv4.tcp_last_ack_timeout, net.ipv4.tcp_max_orphans, net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog, net.ipv4.tcp_mem, net.ipv4.tcp_mtu_probing, net.ipv4.tcp_no_metrics_save, net.ipv4.tcp_orphan_retries, net.ipv4.tcp_retries2, net.ipv4.tcp_rmem, net.ipv4.tcp_rto_max, net.ipv4.tcp_slow_start_after_idle, net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies, net.ipv4.tcp_timestamps, net.ipv4.tcp_tw_recycle, net.ipv4.tcp_tw_reuse, net.ipv4.tcp_wmem, net.ipv4.vs.debug_level, net.ipv6.conf.$interface.autoconf, net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_ra, net.ipv6.conf.all.autoconf, net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6, net.ipv6.conf.default.autoconf, net.ipv6.conf.lo.accept_dad, net.ipv6.conf.lo.autoconf, net.ipv6.conf.lo.dad_transmits, net.ipv6.route.max_size, vm.dirty_background_ratio, vm.dirty_ratio, vm.max_map_count, vm.min_free_kbytes, vm.panic_on_oom, vm.swappiness]

v1WorkloadInstanceSecurityContext.description: Security configuration that will be applied to all containers in the workload instance

hostAliases.description: The list of hosts and IPs that will be injected into the workload instance's hosts file

v1WorkloadInstanceVMRuntimeSettings.description: The specification for VM settings which are applicable to VM workload instance

networkInterfaces.description: Network interfaces to bind to the workload's instances

volumeClaimTemplates.description:
A list of claims that instances may reference

The slug of the claim will be used in combination with the name of the instance to create a stable identifier. The slug should be used in the volume mount specifications for containers and VMs.

v1WorkloadSpec.description: The specification for the desired state of a workload

v1WorkloadStatus.description:
Which status a workload is currently in

- ACTIVE: The workload is active
 - SUSPENDED: The workload is suspended
 - BILLING_SUSPENDED: The workload is suspended due to non-payment
 - INACTIVE: The workload is inactive or has been deleted

v1WrappedImagePullCredentials.description: The credentials needed to pull a container image

stackId.description: The ID of the stack that an instance belongs to

workloadId.description: The ID of the workload that an instance belongs to

name.description:
An instance's name

Instance names are generated from their corresponsing workload's slug, followed by a unique hash

externalIpAddress.description: An instance's publicly accessible IPv4 address

externalIpv6Address.description: An instance's publicly accessible IPv6 address

createdAt.description: The date an instance was created

startedAt.description: The date an instance was started

deletedAt.description: The date an instance was deleted

containerStatuses.description: Status of the containers running within the workload instance

initContainerStatuses.description: Status of the init_containers running within the workload instance

virtualMachineStatuses.description: The status of the virtual machines running within the workload instance

reason.description: A short reason that explains why an instance is in a phase

message.description: A longer message that provides more detail on why an instance is in a phase

scheduledAt.description: The date an instance was scheduled

workloadv1Instance.description: An instance of a workload deployment

workloadv1InstanceInstancePhase.description:
An instance's startup state

- INSTANCE_PHASE_UNSPECIFIED: StackPath is unable to determine the instance's startup state
 - STARTING: The instance is still initializing
 - RUNNING: The instance is running
 - FAILED: The instance failed to start
 - COMPLETED: The instance finished running
 - SCHEDULING: The instance is being scheduled
 - STOPPED: The instance is stopped
 - DELETING: The instance is being deleted

cityCode.description: A location's city, expressed as an IATA airport code

countryCode.description: A location's ISO-3166-1 alpha-2 country code

status.description: A location's status, either active or decommissioned

ipAddress.description: A network interface's primary IPv4 address

ipAddressAliases.description: Additional IPv4 addresses bound to a network interface

gateway.description: A network interface's IPv4 gateway address

ipv6Address.description: A network interface's primary IPv6 address

ipv6AddressAliases.description: Additional IPv6 addresses bound to a network interface

ipv6Gateway.description: A network interface's IPv6 gateway address

workloadv1NetworkInterfaceStatus.description: Network interfaces that are attached to an instance in a workload
